H0.text: Magnetism is the force that pulls things toward the center of Earth.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that pulls things towards the center of Earth.

H2.text: Friction pulls things toward the center of Earth.

H3.text: Energy is the force that pulls things toward the center of Earth.

A4.text: Gravity is the law that every object with mass attracts every other object in the universe in proportion to each mass and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

A5.text: The force of gravity experienced by objects on Earth's surface is the vector sum of two forces: (a) The gravitational attraction in accordance with Newton's universal law of gravitation, and (b) the centrifugal force, which results from the choice of an earthbound, rotating frame of reference.
